body:
nit: even without merge the two types into a single type, I think the order "algorithm, bool, algorithm, bool" works better.

Also I'm not a big fan of default arguments in C++. Overloaded functions tend to work better. But it's up to you.

nit: even without merge the two types into a single type, I think the order "algorithm, bool, algorithm, bool" works better.

Also I'm not a big fan of default arguments in C++. Overloaded functions tend to work better. But it's up to you.
body_text:
nit: even without merge the two types into a single type, I think the order "algorithm, bool, algorithm, bool" works better.
Also I'm not a big fan of default arguments in C++. Overloaded functions tend to work better. But it's up to you.
